ubuntu doesn't cache DNS unless you have a dns server daemon such as ncsd installed. If that's the case, restating the ncsd daemon will flush the cache.
I dont have that installed so this is interesting
Your router is likely caching DNS entries, and your router is likely set as your default DNS server
Interestingly, Google just opened a set of public DNS servers that you could use. I believe they are 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4
